availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John L, Smedley (Mercer County, Kentucky, druggist)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, druggist. Pennsylvania native. Married to Martha O. Smedley. Father of Sarah Smedley, Ovie Smedley, William F. Smedley, and Mariana Smedley Kyle. Elected President of the Shelby Railroad Company in Shelbyville, Kentucky on April 8, 1852. Druggist in Mercer County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned six enslaved individuals in Mercer County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 694.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 3.
"Railroad Convention at Shelbyville,"The Louisville Daily Courier(Louisville, Ky.), April 10, 1852, p. 3.
